facts.fact_text: The S&P/ASX 200 slid more than 1.5% to around 8,750 in early Friday trade, touching a four-week low.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P/ASX 200 slid more than 1.5% to around 8,750 in early Friday trade, touching a four-week low

facts.fact_text: Technology stocks plunged over 4% to reach more than a two-year low.

evidences.evidence_text: Technology stocks led the decline, plunging over 4% to reach more than a two-year low.

facts.fact_text: Gold miners also dropped 3.7% on weak bullion prices.

evidences.evidence_text: Gold miners also dropped 3.7% on weak bullion prices
Heavyweight miners BHP Group and Rio Tinto fell 3.7% and 0.4%, respectively
Heavyweight miners BHP Group and Rio Tinto fell 3.7% and 0.4%, respectively

facts.fact_text: Rio Tinto has also ended takeover talks with Glencore after the companies failed to agree on a deal.

evidences.evidence_text: Rio Tinto has also ended takeover talks with Glencore after the companies failed to agree on a deal that would have delivered sufficient value to shareholders.

links.source_ref: broad-based selling in local resource-linked stocks

evidence.evidence_text: The S&P/ASX 200 slid more than 1.5% to around 8,750 in early Friday trade, touching a four-week low, as broad-based selling in local resource-linked stocks and a tech-driven slump on Wall Street overnight weighed heavily on sentiment.

The S&P/ASX 200 slid more than 1.5% to around 8,750 in early Friday trade, touching a four-week low, as broad-based selling in local resource-linked stocks and a tech-driven slump on Wall Street overnight weighed heavily on sentiment.
Sector leaders Wisetech Global, Xero, and Technology One dropped between 3% and 6%, tracking US tech giants lower amid weak earnings results and concerns over AI trade.
Sector leaders Wisetech Global, Xero, and Technology One dropped between 3% and 6%, tracking US tech giants lower amid weak earnings results and concerns over AI trade.
Gold miners also dropped 3.7% on weak bullion prices, pulling the broader mining sub-index down 2.9%.
